title: Showers expected in several provinces after 1pm
byline: Showers or thundershowers will occur at most parts of the island after 1.00 p.m.

title: IMF chief says world lacks ethical, regulatory base to manage rise of AI
byline: Countries around the world lack the regulatory and ethical foundations needed to manage the rapid rise of artificial intelligence (AI), International Monetary Fund (IMF) chief Kristalina Georgieva said on Monday (Oct 13), urging civil society groups to “ring the alarm bells.”

title: ‘Now the rebuilding begins,’ says Trump as he signs Gaza peace plan
byline: US President Donald Trump and the leaders of Egypt, Qatar and Turkey have signed a declaration for bringing peace to Gaza at a summit in the Egyptian resort of Sharm el- Sheikh.

title: Foreign nationals eligible for free tourist visa must obtain ETA prior to arrival in Sri Lanka from Oct. 15
byline: All foreign nationals eligible for free tourist visa must obtain an Electronic Travel Authorisation (ETA) prior to arrival in Sri Lanka from 15 October.

title: Will electricity tariffs increase?
byline: The final decision regarding the revision of electricity tariffs will be announced by the Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) today (14).

title: Indian officials seize drugs worth Rs 500 million trafficked from Sri Lanka; Three held at Bengaluru Airport
byline: Officials of the Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) India have seized drugs worth around Rs 500 million illegally transported from Colombo to Bengaluru.

title: New time-based tariff scheme for BESS approved
byline: The government has approved the introduction of a Time-Based Tariff Scheme for Battery Energy Storage Systems integrated with Rooftop Solar Photovoltaic installations, the Ceylon Electricity Board said in a statement.

title: Over 62,000 tourists arrive in first 12 days of October
byline: The number of tourists who arrived in the country in the first 12 days of October stood at 62,741, the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority has announced.

title: Foreign nationals eligible for free visa must obtain ETA prior to arrival in Sri Lanka from Oct. 15
byline: It has been made mandatory for all foreign nationals eligible for free tourist visa to obtain an Electronic Travel Authorisation (ETA) prior to their arrival in the country.

title: What you need to know as Microsoft ends Windows 10 support
byline: Microsoft will cease customer support for its operating system Windows 10 on Oct. 14 and is encouraging users to upgrade to Windows 11.

title: China says will ‘fight to the end’ in US trade war
byline: China said on Tuesday it was ready to “fight to the end” in a trade war with the United States after President Donald Trump said he would impose an additional 100 per cent tariff on the world’s second-largest economy.

title: US Travel Advisory for Sri Lanka updated
byline: The United States of America has updated its travel advisory for Sri Lanka.

title: Special meeting today to expedite restoration of online government services affected across 8 departments
byline: A special meeting with relevant officials is scheduled to be held today to expedite the restoration of online government services that were disrupted, impacting eight departments.

title: Indian officials seize drugs worth Rs 500 million trafficked from Sri Lanka
byline: Officials of the Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) India have seized drugs worth around Rs 500 million illegally transported from Colombo to Bengaluru.

title: At least 44 people dead after torrential rains in Mexico
byline: At least 44 people were killed in Mexico after days of heavy rains and flooding, the government said on Sunday.

title: Heavy showers above 100mm expected in parts of the island today
byline: Showers or thundershowers will occur at most parts of the island after 1.00 p.m. today (14), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: ‘Ishara Sewwandi’ arrested in Nepal
byline: ‘Ishara Sewwandi’, the fugitive female suspect wanted in connection with the murder of underworld figure Sanjeewa Kumara Samararatne, alias ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa,’ has reportedly been arrested in Nepal.

title: Three MRI scanners at Colombo National Hospital out of service?
byline: Three MRI scanners at the Colombo National Hospital are currently non-operational, the Government Radiological Technologists’ Association (GRTA) has stated.

title: Ex-Navy Commander Nishantha Ulugetenne granted bail
byline: The Kurunegala High Court has granted bail to former Commander of the Sri Lanka Navy (SLN), Admiral (Retired) Nishantha Ulugetenne.

title: Shasheendra Rajapaksa granted bail
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has granted bail to former State Minister Shasheendra Rajapaksa, who was arrested and remanded by the Bribery Commission on allegations of offenses under the Public Property Act.

title: Court dismisses anticipatory bail application by Manusha Nanayakkara
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has dismissed the anticipatory bail application filed by former Minister Manusha Nanayakkara, seeking release prior to a possible arrest by the Bribery Commission.

title: Ex-President Gotabaya clarifies media reports on Kataragama building
byline: Former President Gotabaya Rajapaksa states that certain media outlets have incorrectly reported that a building constructed by another individual near the Menik Ganga in Kataragama belongs to him.

title: Underworld figure ‘Bus Lalith’ arrested in Dubai
byline: Notorious underworld figure Lalith Kannangara, also known as ‘Bus Lalith’, has been arrested in Dubai.

title: PM Harini holds talk with Chinese President Xi Jinping
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya, who is in Beijing for the Global Leaders’ Meeting on Women, met with Chinese President Xi Jinping on Tuesday.

title: No change in electricity tariffs for next three months – PUCSL
byline: The Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) has decided not to amend the existing electricity tariffs for this quarter.

title: Several packages suspected to contain narcotics recovered in southern seas
byline: A number of packages suspected to contain narcotics have been recovered by the Sri Lanka Navy while floating in seas off the Southern coast.

title: Phone numbers of Australia PM and Donald Trump Jr publicly listed on website
byline: The private phone numbers of several high-profile figures including Australia’s Prime Minister and Donald Trump Jr have been published on a US website.

title: Constable involved in Mt. Lavinia court incident transferred to Piliyandala Police
byline: The police constable involved in the incident with a lawyer at the Mount Lavinia Court premises has been transferred from the Mount Lavinia Police Station to the Piliyandala Police Station.

title: Local gold price hits another all-time high, price of 22-carat sovereign surges to Rs. 337,600
byline: The price of a 22-carat gold sovereign in Sri Lanka has surpassed Rs. 330,000 for the first time today (14).

title: Cache of ammunition found near school in Thalawa
byline: A stock of live ammunition and empty cartridges has been discovered near Mudunegama Maha Vidyalaya in Thalawa, earlier today (14).

title: Easter Sunday attacks: Court to hear petition on commission recommendations against Nilantha Jayawardena
byline: The Court of Appeal today (14) ordered that a hearing be held on March 24, 2025 to examine the facts of a writ petition filed requesting that instructions be issued to the Attorney General and the Inspector General of Police...

title: Motor Traffic Dept. confirms no disruptions to its services
byline: The Department of Motor Traffic states that its operations are continuing without any interruptions.

title: Trump ‘looking forward’ to Thailand-Cambodia ceasefire deal at ASEAN summit, Malaysia says
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump will visit Malaysia on October 26, Foreign Minister Mohamad Hasan said on Tuesday, adding that he was “looking forward” to witnessing a ceasefire deal between Southeast Asian neighbours Thailand and Cambodia.

title: Taylor Swift net worth surpasses $2 billion following ‘The Life of a Showgirl’ album success
byline: Taylor Swift’s net worth surpassed $2 billion by October 2025, with financial growth attributed to her latest album “The Life of a Showgirl” and additional major projects.

title: Cabinet approval to import Ponni Samba rice due to Keeri Samba shortage
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to allow rice importers to import up to 520 metric tons of Ponni Samba rice per importer without permits, as an alternative to Keeri Samba, which is reported to be in short supply in the local market.

title: ‘Ratama Ekata’ National Operation to combat drug menace gets Cabinet nod
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to establish a National Operational Council to implement an emergency rapid program titled “Ratama Ekata – National Operation,” an initiative which aims to eradicate the drug menace and rehabilitate drug addicts through broad public participation.

title: Police reveal how Ishara Sewwandi fled to Nepal
byline: Ishara Sewwandi, who is wanted as a main suspect in the murder of organized crime gang member Sanjeewa Kumara Samararatne, was arrested in Nepal following a special operation carried out in that country, under diplomatic assistance, Police stated.

title: Colombo stock market cap crosses Rs. 8 trillion for first time
byline: The total market capitalization of the Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) crossed the Rs. 8 trillion mark for the very first time in history today with an impressive 40.48% year-to-date (YTD) growth.

title: Israel says it opens fire on suspects in Gaza, local authorities report six killed
byline: Israel’s military said it opened fire on Tuesday to remove a threat posed by suspects who approached its forces in the northern Gaza Strip, and health authorities in the enclave said at least six Palestinians had been killed by Israeli fire.

title: President directs officials to fully utilize funds allocated for this year’s dev projects
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake emphasized that state officials have a vital responsibility as the key intermediary mechanism in ensuring that the benefits of government development projects reach the people.

title: Suspected narcotics haul recovered from southern seas brought to Tangalle Harbour
byline: UPDATE: The 51 packages discovered floating in the seas off the southern coast, recovered by the Sri Lanka Navy and brought to the Tangalle Fisheries Harbour, have been confirmed to contain ‘ice’ (crystal methamphetamine), hashish, and heroin, according to the Sri Lanka Navy.

title: Madagascar’s military takes power, says colonel
byline: Madagascar’s military has taken charge of the Indian Ocean island, an army colonel said on Tuesday, after President Andry Rajoelina fled abroad during a standoff with youth-led protesters and security forces.
